Create a physical library: If all the internet servers were to crash, it would be a good idea to create a physical library. You can gather books from various sources and store them in a central location. This way, people can still access information and knowledge by reading books.
Use offline resources: You can use offline resources like CDs, DVDs, and USB drives to store information. You can also use paper-based resources like maps, newspapers, and magazines.

Use satellite communication: Satellite communication can be used to access information from remote locations. You can set up a satellite link to connect with other parts of the world and access information.
Use local servers: You can set up local servers in your community or organization to store and share information. This way, people can still access information even if the internet servers crash.

Use peer-to-peer networks: Peer-to-peer networks can be used to share information among users. You can set up a peer-to-peer network and share information with other users in your community or organization.
